thread.title: Chicago Cubs Pitcher Hector Rondon Got Locked Inside Bullpen Bathroom During NLDS Game 1
thread.title_full: Chicago Cubs Pitcher Hector Rondon Got Locked Inside Bullpen Bathroom During NLDS Game 1 | Complex

author: Dana Scott
title: Chicago Cubs Pitcher Hector Rondon Got Locked Inside Bullpen Bathroom During NLDS Game 1
text:
Chicago Cubs closer Hector Rondon was apparently locked for several minutes in the bullpen during Game 1 of the National League Division Series versus the St. Louis Cardinals.
According to Joe Walsh, the Busch Stadium director of operations, the latch on the lock had malfunctioned, and became frozen after the latter innings of the game on Friday night.
Walsh also stated that city fire department officials were on standby before personnel fixed the lock to finally let Rondon out.
The team replaced the lock before Game 2 Saturday. And if the Cubs lose the series, would the name of this potential conspiracy theory be titled "Latch-Gate?" Give us some more potential titles in the Comment section below.
Send all complaints, compliments, and tips to sportstips@complex.com
[via Associated Press ]
